abstract.text: Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within a floating-point 16-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved image.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a vImage buffer structure that contains the source image.
A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. You’re responsible for filling out the
, and

fields of this structure and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
This parameter also specifies the size of the region of interest within the source image. The region of interest has the same height and width as the destination image buffer.
The horizontal offset, in pixels, from the upper-left pixel of the region of interest within the source image.
The vertical offset, in pixels, from the upper-left pixel of the region of interest within the source image.
A translation value for the horizontal direction.
The slope of the front edge of the sheared image, measured in a clockwise direction.
The resampling filter that the function uses. For more information, see
A background color. If you set the
flag, pass a pixel value.
The options to use when applying the transform.
To specify how vImage handles pixel locations beyond the edge of the source image, set one of the following flags:
or
If you want vImage to use a higher quality but a slower resampling filter, set the
flag.
If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
This function ignores the
flag.
If you want vImage to use faster but lower-precision internal arithmetic, set the
flag.
; otherwise, one of the error codes described in

This function uses a resampling filter that you specify to shear, resize, and translate an image in one dimension. Use the resampling filter’s scale property to resize the image and the translate parameter to adjust the position of the destination image. The function transforms as much of the source image as it needs to fill the destination buffer. Therefore, it can transform pixels outside the region of interest.
This function doesn’t work in place — that is, the source and destination buffers must point to different memory.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A pointer to a resampling filter callback function.
Reflect, shear, rotate, and scale image buffers using vImage.
A flag that uses the background color for missing pixels.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
A flag that extends the edges of the image infinitely.
A flag that uses a higher-quality, slower resampling filter for geometry operations.
A flag that restricts the operation to red, green, and blue channels only.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that specifies vImage uses faster but lower-precision internal arithmetic for floating-point 16-bit operations.
Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within a floating-point 16-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved image.
Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within a signed 16-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved image.
Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within an unsigned 16-bit-per-channel, 4-channel interleaved image.
Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within a floating-point 16-bit-per-channel, 2-channel interleaved image.
Performs a double-precision horizontal shear on a region of interest within a floating-point 16-bit planar image.
A type for the number of pixels.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
Implement custom linear interpolation to prevent the ringing effects associated with scaling an image with the default Lanczos algorithm.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Reducing artifacts with custom resampling filters

abstract.text: A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A double-precision, floating-point value type.
A 16-bit unsigned integer value type.
